page.title: 16BURY FEN SKATERS
page.content:
In the{winter}the fields around Earith {flood}and{freeze}over. When this happens,{skating}competitions are held.It froze over in January, 1985.
Whizzing, Whirling round the track, Skaters racing two by two. Bending backs, bending knees, Mr. Fisher in the lead. He's got one hand behind his back, Swinging hands to and fro. Crowds are shouting'Come on, come on' Three laps have gone, one more to go. Crowds are shouting'Well done!' In he goes to recieve the trophy. The watchers of the race are huddled, Slipping, sliding about the ice. The ice is cracking under my feet, My toes have gone numb, My fingers too!
(By Tracy Wicks age 10 years)
